title: Sultan Sats
author: Sultan Sats
content: Hey all, I can't believe I've waited this long to create an account here and join the forum. I can't seem to find a complete list of Bitcoin-only companies anywhere so I'd like to start one here. I'm looking to join a company and my options are limited since I don't have a developer/engineering background. Some companies on my radar: - Strike - CoinFlip - BitGo- Satoshi Energy- US Bitcoin Corp

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: What do you mean by Bitcoin-only companies? Those who pay with Bitcoin, those who do Bitcoin-related business? If you're trying to join them, maybe you can focus on your skill first. Translation, design, customer service, etc are usually open for remote positions (I work with some companies like this in the past). Check out the service board too, while the companies might not be as big as what you listed, some of them do hire people there.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Sultan Sats on October 13, 2022, 08:17:54 PMStrike@Sultan Sats, Not sure if my understanding is the same as yours or not, I clearly saw one of the companies named 'Strike' in your topic, as far as I know it is a company engaged in making payments and services with digital currencies such as bitcoin.Whether you are looking for exchange companies, transaction services, services, goods, mining sites, wallets, trading and so on related to crypto, especially Bitcoin, for that I can only refer you to: Topic: [HUGE LIST] Useful Crypto Links !!!, you can see there @Ratimov has summarized all the crypto webs there, you can see, who knows your purpose is there.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Perhaps try looking into job posting websites?https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/careers.htmlhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5251518.0https://jobs.cointelegraph.com/?Posting in general go-to platforms e.g. indeed and searching for related keywords could also help.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: So your purpose is to look for a job that pays in Bitcoin?That is why you are looking for a list of bitcoin companies.There are lots of bitcoin companies you can check them out here - https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_bitcoin_companies Also, Google will give you a list of bitcoin companies hereWhat skill exactly do you have? You can offer your skill here in the forum in the services section and then accept Bitcoin as payment.Or if you have knowledge about SEO you can do CPA marketing there some companies that pays Bitcoin like CPAbuild, Adworkmedia and I think Maxbounty also pays Bitcoin.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: I am curious about what does mean Bitcoin company. Bitcoin doesn't have any companies. Whether a few companies pay salaries in Bitcoin or a few companies invested in Bitcoin. It doesn't mean it's a Bitcoin company. Bitcoin is a truly decentralized cryptocurrency that would be accepted or pay by any company in the world. By the way, welcome to the forum. Don't hesitate to read the forums thread to learn more about Bitcoin. You may learn a lot of useful things related to Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies from this forum.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: The Cryptovator on October 14, 2022, 05:54:36 PMI am curious about what does mean Bitcoin company. Bitcoin doesn't have any companies.I think he was trying to mean companies that are related to bitcoin (Like exchanges, custodial services, Bitcoin mining services etc.) though the term he chose is vague because I am sure there are thousands and thousands of companies and services related to Bitcoin

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: I believe Angellist has has a few cryptocurrency companies posting there from time to time. Other than that, checking the service announcement section on the forum would give you a good idea who would be interested in paying their employees in Bitcoin. I wouldn't limit yourself to Bitcoin only paying companies though. You can always just receive the fiat, and purchase the Bitcoin amount that you want for that payment period. Yeah, you'll be dealing with fees, but at least you'll be able to decide how much you want to invest, instead of being fully invested.
